A 10.25 billion deal to combine the two companies had been agreed by parent companies CK Hutchison and Telefonica in a transaction that would have created the UK's largest mobile operator with 40 per cent of the market. The two parties had argued that Three and O2 would struggle to compete independently as pure-play operators.
